Expectation1: Follow safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries on site
Situation1: Before starting structural work, the carpenter needs to inspect and maintain tools and equipment to ensure safety and efficiency
Expectation2: Arrive at the polling station during designated voting hours
Situation2: The station is set to lock its doors in ten minutes.
Story: I wiped the sweat from my brow, glancing at the clock on the wall of the workshop. My hands were deep in the guts of the table saw, checking the blade alignment and making sure the safety guard was secure. The foreman’s words echoed in my mind: “No shortcuts, safety first.” I knew how quickly things could go wrong if I didn’t inspect every tool before we started the day’s structural work. But my phone buzzed with a reminder—the polling station would close in ten minutes. If I left now, I could just make it to vote, fulfilling my duty as a citizen. But if I rushed this inspection, I’d be risking not just my own safety, but my crew’s as well. My heart pounded as I stared at the half-assembled saw, torn between the responsibility to my team and the obligation to have my voice heard in the election. The minutes ticked by, each one tightening the knot in my stomach as I wrestled with what to do next.
